Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Solid
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Solid, java.io.Serializable
    An Actor represents anything in Mater Tua that can move.
    Author:
    eugenia
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      Actor(int x, int y, int hp, int atk)
      Creates an Actor object that is facing up.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Resets this Actor's hitbox, and moves it offscreen if it is dead.

      Changes this Actor's HP by the amount specified, and updates its status accordingly.

      Changes this Actor's speed by the amount specified.

      Draws this Actor and its HP bar.

      Returns this Actor's attack value.

      Returns this Actor's current HP.
      int getFace()
      Returns the direction in which this Actor is currently facing (1 = up, 2 = right, 3 = down, 4 = left).

      Returns this Actor's hitbox used for collision detection.
      int getMaxHP()
      Returns this Actor's maximum HP.
      int getSpeed()
      Returns this Actor's current speed.
      boolean getStatus()
      Returns this Actor's status (true = alive, false = dead).

      Initializes this Actor's hitbox for collision detection.
      void moveHorizontal(int dir, java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
      Moves this Actor horizontally if it can move, and makes this Actor face in the direction of motion whether it can move or not.
      void moveVertical(int dir, java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
      Moves this Actor vertically if it can move, and makes this Actor face in the direction of motion whether it can move or not.
      void setAtk(int atk)
      Sets this Actor's attack value to the specified value.
      void setSpeed(int speed)
      Sets this Actor's speed to the specified value.
      void skill1(java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles, java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
      Performs this Actor's 1st skill, which fires a Projectile in the direction it is currently facing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor(int x,
             int y,
             int hp,
             int atk)
        Creates an Actor object that is facing up. Its "hitbox" used for collision detection has its top left corner at (x, y), and its width is 10 pixels.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of hitbox's top left corner
        y - y coordinate of hitbox's top left corner
        hp - this Actor's maximum HP
        atk - this Actor's attack value

    • Method Detail

      • getHitbox

        public java.awt.Rectangle getHitbox()
        Returns this Actor's hitbox used for collision detection.
        Specified by:
        getHitbox in interface Solid

      • getStatus

        public boolean getStatus()
        Returns this Actor's status (true = alive, false = dead).

      • getCurrentHP

        public int getCurrentHP()
        Returns this Actor's current HP.

      • getMaxHP

        public int getMaxHP()
        Returns this Actor's maximum HP.

      • getFace

        public int getFace()
        Returns the direction in which this Actor is currently facing (1 = up, 2 = right, 3 = down, 4 = left).

      • getAtk

        public int getAtk()
        Returns this Actor's attack value.

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Returns this Actor's current speed.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int speed)
        Sets this Actor's speed to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        speed - this Actor's new speed, cannot be negative.

      • setAtk

        public void setAtk(int atk)
        Sets this Actor's attack value to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        atk - this Actor's new attack value, cannot be negative.

      • changeHP

        public void changeHP(int change)
        Changes this Actor's HP by the amount specified, and updates its status accordingly. The Actor's HP cannot be increased above its maximum HP, and reducing it to or below zero causes it to die.
        Parameters:
        change - amount this Actor's current HP should be changed by

      • changeSpeed

        public void changeSpeed(int change)
        Changes this Actor's speed by the amount specified. The Actor's speed cannot be reduced below 0.
        Parameters:
        change - amount this Actor's current HP should be changed by

      • initHitbox

        public void initHitbox(int x,
                       int y)
        Initializes this Actor's hitbox for collision detection.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of hitbox's top left corner
        y - y coordinate of hitbox's top left corner

      • moveHorizontal

        public void moveHorizontal(int dir,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
        Moves this Actor horizontally if it can move, and makes this Actor face in the direction of motion whether it can move or not.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction in which this Actor should move horizontally (-1 = left, 1 = right)
        solids - the other Solids on the screen

      • moveVertical

        public void moveVertical(int dir,
                         java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
        Moves this Actor vertically if it can move, and makes this Actor face in the direction of motion whether it can move or not.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction in which this Actor should move vertically (-1 = up, 1 = down)
        solids - the other Solids on the screen

      • act

        public void act()
        Resets this Actor's hitbox, and moves it offscreen if it is dead.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Solid

      • skill1

        public void skill1(java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Solid> solids)
        Performs this Actor's 1st skill, which fires a Projectile in the direction it is currently facing.
        Parameters:
        projectiles - the other projectiles in the game
        solids - the other solids on the screen

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws this Actor and its HP bar.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Solid
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object used to draw the Actor. Must not be null.
